C G I M P R S T V

C

calculateClues() - Method in class minesweeper
calculates clue values and updates clue values in mines array
integer value 9 represents a mine
clue values will be 0 ... 8

G

gameWon() - Method in class minesweeper
Level 2 - game won status
getBoard(int, int) - Method in class minesweeper
getBoard - determines current game board character for r,c position using the value of the mines[][] and tiles[][]array
Level 1 - returns 1-8 for clue values, question mark for question, X for closed
space for blank, F for flag, * for mine
Level 2 - returns exclamation point for mine that lost game, - for mis-flagged mines
returns F for all mines when game is won
getCols() - Method in class minesweeper
number of columns for board
getMines(int, int) - Method in class minesweeper
value of the mines array at r,c
-1 is returned if invalid r,c
getRows() - Method in class minesweeper
number of rows for board
getStatus() - Method in class minesweeper
Level 2 - game status
getTiles(int, int) - Method in class minesweeper
value of the tiles array at r,c -1 is returned if invalid r,c

I

initGame(int, int) - Method in class minesweeper
create mines & tiles array place mines
update clues

M

markTile(int, int, int) - Method in class minesweeper
mark tile - open tile, close tile, flag tile as mine, set tile as question mark, close tile Level 1 - Requirements
- invalid r,c values must be ignored
- a tile that is opened must stay open
- a tile that is marked as a flag (ie. tile[][] value 3) can not be opened

Level 2 - Requirements
- tile values can only change when game status is "play"
- game status must be updated after a tile is opened

mines - Variable in class minesweeper
mine and clue values, 9 - mine, 0-8 clue values
minesweeper - class minesweeper.
minesweeper class provides the data
and methods for a minesweper game

Level 1 - data & methods to implement
Mines, Clues, Tiles, basic Board characters,
and opening/marking tiles Level 2 - Additional data & methods to support game status
and extended Board characters
minesweeper.java
spring 2004

minesweeper() - Constructor for class minesweeper
default constructor
board size 9 x 9
create mines and tile arrays
place mines
calculate clues
(*)set game status to play
minesweeper(int, int) - Constructor for class minesweeper
alternate constructor use specifies board size
create mines and tile arrays
place mines
calculate clues
(*)set game status to play

P

placeMines() - Method in class minesweeper
places mines randomly on grid integer value 9 represents a mine
number of mines = (1 + number of columns * number rows) / 10
minimum number of mines = 1

R

resetTiles() - Method in class minesweeper
Sets all tiles to 1 - closed

S

status - Variable in class minesweeper
Level 2 - game status win, lose, play

T

tiles - Variable in class minesweeper
tile values 0 - open, 1 - closed,
2 - question, 3 - mine
toStringBoard() - Method in class minesweeper
game board array as String
toStringMines() - Method in class minesweeper
mines array as String
toStringTiles() - Method in class minesweeper
tiles array as String

V

validIndex(int, int) - Method in class minesweeper
determines if x,y is valid position
